topic.title: JavaScript - what went wrong?
topic.body: JavaScript is an utter nightmare for both security (malware attacks) and privacy (fingerprinting). How did such bad technology become a ubiquitous standard in the Internet? Can it realistically be replaced by something better?

topic.title: Without open hardware, we have no privacy or security
topic.body:
Most privacy-conscious people preach that if you use fully-Libre with no binary blobs like Debian, you can be sure you are not spied on. WRONG. The fucking CPU you are using has that nightmarish proprietary Intel ME or AMD PSP which basically has access to all of your RAM and can bypass any encryption and send it over the Internet back to those tech giants or anyone else. Even your keyboard and mouse may as well be logging your every key via their proprietary firmware and send it too. At least you can use libreboot for the motherboard, but that's too little.

The only way of actually having any privacy is to physically disconnect from the internet, the GPS and also make sure your hardware doesn't have a hidden WIFI card that can silently connect to any nearby unprotected network and send your data this way. 

Also, don't get me started on always-on microphones in our phones, even dumbphones! They can remotely spy all they want, unless you physically break it by dismantling your device. I DO NOT even want to possess any phone and carry it with me to track my every step, but please explain that to my sheeple employer or family...

Oh, and by the way, even speakers connected to output-only port can be remotely reconfigured to act as a microphone (with shitty audio quality, but working nonetheless). So you can't even safely watch movies at home. Yuck.

We need fully opensource hardware AND physical killswitches for cameras and mics, or else we're still fucked.

topic.title: Can't easily delete/recreate ZeroID indentity?
topic.body:
I can't seem to find any way to create a new identity. If I delete the whole zeronet folder it will do the trick, but it shouldn't be that complicated. This is a privacy-friendly network after all, there should be a way to ditch your old nickname and create a new one!

Just like everyone on r/privacy does - creating random-nickname accounts, then post for a few weeks, and then mass-delete your posts and account and make a new one.

topic.title: Religion is the cancer of civilization
topic.body: In the past, it helped unite huge masses under a common allegiance, but it's high time we saw it's all fiction, business and slavery. I'm happy atheism is growing, and in the next few decades, religion may be a minority.

topic.title: ZeroNet won't update
topic.body: I have version 0.6.5, I tried to update but after it disconnected and reconnected I still have old version... do I have to redownload the whole zeronet from website?

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: What parameter do I have to launch the ZeroNet script with so that it opens in Tor (or no browser at all) by default, and not my actual default browser? Using Linux.

> [r3naam3r](#comment_1_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw6zQxM): What parameter do I have to launch the ZeroNet script with so that it opens in Tor (or no browser at all) by default, and not my actual default browser? Using Linux.

OK figured it out, I just have to add "--open_browser some-nonexisting-name"

1560995957_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8B.body: Please at least use invidio.us instead of YT links. We're in ZeroNet, after all. PeerTube would be the most preferred.

1563975046_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body: You forgot the most important pro: money-hungry banks don't track all of your purchase data and sell it to third-parties

1563904309_164cJJtm3Q2Xd7NZbFxJYngmW8MSq.body:
Ross got double life in supermax for hosting a website. His sentence is more of a scare-message for other Tor webmasters than any sort of justice. I hope they finally at least lessen duration of his sentence.

Although TBH he was quite stupid - he walked away from his laptop while having silkroad open, and previously even hinted at his current occupation on his linkedin profile. He also ordered parcel with fake passports to his actual home address

1563548848_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: Both systemd and gnome are opensource, they may be less secure (I don't know this, really) but at least they dont spy on you, right? Also, if everyone used their own solutions for everything to avoid being dependent on specific project, none of them would be well tested and thus very insecure. If you want maximum privacy and security, design your own hardware, produce it yourself, write an OS and its programs all by yourself from scratch, and prepare to bug-test the shit out of them until the rest of your days before even daring to use the internet for any actual work or entertainment on such setup. When you're 90 years old, you've (maybe) finally done it! But... was it worth it?

1563985981_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
I tried finding an automated backup program on Linux. All of them were shit for my likings, so I eventually wrote my own scripts to do it. Best decision I ever made - it is now fully independent and works EXACTLY the way I want it.

However, being scared of having to do "everything" in the terminal is what keeps almost all people I know from migrating to linux. People are just lazy and don't have that feeling of responsibility that in order to use powerful technology we have today, you have to learn a bit how it works and how to use it well.

1563987524_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw.body:
> [parad0x](#comment_3_1DBWQfUYNcyjPMMc22b6PUDxHNz5iCM6E3): https://puri.sm/Check out their stuff, it's what you are looking for. Hardware killswitches on their laptops, Intel ME neutralized and FSF approved OS.

Yeah I know about them, but I won't pay $2000 + shipping + 23% VAT for a 1-year, overseas pseudowarranty and ship it all the way from US to EU for such an important daily use thing as a PC/laptop.
My only bet is to use ancient Thinkpad with libreboot or very weak Raspberry Pi, but I want my PC to be actually useful AND free of builtin malware.

Although I am excited about upcoming PinePhone since it will be dirty cheap and has killswitches and open hardware.
5G is creepy as hell, I will not use 5G-enabled phone for as long as possibly possible

1566241934_13ifSHXbs2RtyHF4qkn4GrJ3krWEA.body: I keep my ZeroNet on a Linux system with encrypted hard drive, and use it with forced Tor. Recommend this to everyone else for true security and privacy.

> [ratsmack](#comment_22_16BaY5JLzzA8TPe4jzXtp3CfZi3Qks2SU5): It's funny how Security Concerned people willingly trust a VPN service: https://gist.github.com/joepie91/5a9909939e6ce7d09e29 [...]

So find me a better alternative for system-wide secure connection. VPNs at least protect me from ISP spying, protect me from copyright scareletters, and allow me to bypass geoblock. They are definitely better than using clear connection. I'd rather some privacy-friendly country VPN have my logs who may not sell them to admakers than my ISP who will DEFINITELY sell them and keep them forever.

> [crazylime](#comment_148_1D9oYXWZH2S55PeoCFDKTqq8roNXqZqP7n): What do you mean by "forced Tor"?  ZN's "Tor Always"?  OS-level proxy forcing all Internet through Tor?

Maybe I worded that badly, but I meant just starting zeronet .sh with "--tor always " parameter.

1568481715_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw.body:
> [pexo](#comment_152_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC): ZeroNet version 7.x.x runs on python3. ZeroNet version 6.x.x runs on python2. These two are incompatible with one another and you cannot upgrade from 6.x.x to 7.x.x, so you'll have to redownload ZeroNet. Be sure to backup your data directory so you can use it in the 7.x.x version.

ok I'll do that
